New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his 95th extra-base hit of the season, a franchise record
Key Match Events: Manny Machado started a game-ending triple play and the San Diego Padres clinched a postseason berth with a 4-2 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers
Jake Cronenworth hit an early two-run homer for the Padres
The Dodgers scored once in the ninth inning, then had runners at first and second when Miguel Rojas hit a sharp grounder to Machado at third base
Machado stepped on the bag and went around the horn for a triple play that ended it
Pre-Game Insights: The Padres have won four in a row and nine of 10, and own the tiebreaker against the Dodgers with an 8-3 record in head-to-head matchups
The Dodgers' magic number remained four to clinch the division title
Post-Match Reflections: Machado said, 'We’re going to enjoy tonight, enjoy this game, enjoy the celebration, but the job’s not finished yet'
Roberts said, 'We’ve got to give Manny credit, he made a heck of a play'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of 50,369 fans who created a playoff atmosphere for the opener of the huge three-game series
The Padres' celebration was delayed when the Dodgers challenged the out call at second base, but the ruling was upheld following a replay review
Others: Padres starter Michael King (13-9) allowed one unearned run and three hits in five innings
Rookie starter Landon Knack (3-5) gave up four runs and five hits in four innings for the Dodgers
